intro: Mesosphaerum camporum, commonly known as the Camp's mesosphaerum, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pentamerous flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
